fields.name: name
fields.doc: A human-readable name for the style.

fields.name: metadata
fields.doc: Arbitrary properties useful to track with the stylesheet, but do not influence rendering. Properties should be prefixed to avoid collisions, like 'maplibre:'.

fields.name: center
fields.doc: Default map center in longitude and latitude.  The style center will be used only if the map has not been positioned by other means (e.g. map options or user interaction).

fields.name: zoom
fields.doc: Default zoom level.  The style zoom will be used only if the map has not been positioned by other means (e.g. map options or user interaction).

fields.name: bearing
fields.doc: Default bearing, in degrees. The bearing is the compass direction that is "up"; for example, a bearing of 90° orients the map so that east is up. This value will be used only if the map has not been positioned by other means (e.g. map options or user interaction).

fields.name: pitch
fields.doc: Default pitch, in degrees. Zero is perpendicular to the surface, for a look straight down at the map, while a greater value like 60 looks ahead towards the horizon. The style pitch will be used only if the map has not been positioned by other means (e.g. map options or user interaction).

fields.name: light
fields.doc: The global light source.

fields.name: sky
fields.doc: The map's sky configuration. **Note:** this definition is still experimental and is under development in maplibre-gl-js.

fields.name: projection
fields.doc: The projection configuration. **Note:** this definition is still experimental and is under development in maplibre-gl-js.

fields.name: terrain
fields.doc: The terrain configuration.

fields.name: sources
fields.doc:
Sources state which data the map should display. Specify the type of source with the `type` property. Adding a source isn't enough to make data appear on the map because sources don't contain styling details like color or width. Layers refer to a source and give it a visual representation. This makes it possible to style the same source in different ways, like differentiating between types of roads in a highways layer.

Tiled sources (vector and raster) must specify their details according to the [TileJSON specification](https://github.com/mapbox/tilejson-spec).

fields.name: sprite
fields.doc: An array of `{id: 'my-sprite', url: 'https://example.com/sprite'}` objects. Each object should represent a unique URL to load a sprite from and and a unique ID to use as a prefix when referencing images from that sprite (i.e. 'my-sprite:image'). All the URLs are internally extended to load both .json and .png files. If the `id` field is equal to 'default', the prefix is omitted (just 'image' instead of 'default:image'). All the IDs and URLs must be unique. For backwards compatibility, instead of an array, one can also provide a single string that represent a URL to load the sprite from. The images in this case won't be prefixed.

fields.name: glyphs
fields.doc:
A URL template for loading signed-distance-field glyph sets in PBF format. 

The URL must include:

 - `{fontstack}` - When requesting glyphs, this token is replaced with a comma separated list of fonts from a font stack specified in the text-font property of a symbol layer. 

 - `{range}` - When requesting glyphs, this token is replaced with a range of 256 Unicode code points. For example, to load glyphs for the Unicode Basic Latin and Basic Latin-1 Supplement blocks, the range would be 0-255. The actual ranges that are loaded are determined at runtime based on what text needs to be displayed.

This property is required if any layer uses the `text-field` layout property. The URL must be absolute, containing the [scheme, authority and path components](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/URL#Syntax).

fields.name: transition
fields.doc: A global transition definition to use as a default across properties, to be used for timing transitions between one value and the next when no property-specific transition is set. Collision-based symbol fading is controlled independently of the style's `transition` property.

fields.name: layers
fields.doc:
A style's `layers` property lists all the layers available in that style. The type of layer is specified by the `type` property, and must be one of `background`, `fill`, `line`, `symbol`, `raster`, `circle`, `fill-extrusion`, `heatmap`, `hillshade`.

Except for layers of the `background` type, each layer needs to refer to a source. Layers take the data that they get from a source, optionally filter features, and then define how those features are styled.

fields.name: type
fields.doc: The type of the source.

fields.name: url
fields.doc: A URL to a TileJSON resource. Supported protocols are `http:` and `https:`.

fields.name: tiles
fields.doc: An array of one or more tile source URLs, as in the TileJSON spec.

fields.name: bounds
fields.doc: An array containing the longitude and latitude of the southwest and northeast corners of the source's bounding box in the following order: `[sw.lng, sw.lat, ne.lng, ne.lat]`. When this property is included in a source, no tiles outside of the given bounds are requested by MapLibre.

fields.name: scheme
fields.doc: Influences the y direction of the tile coordinates. The global-mercator (aka Spherical Mercator) profile is assumed.

fields.name: minzoom
fields.doc: Minimum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec.

fields.name: maxzoom
fields.doc: Maximum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec. Data from tiles at the maxzoom are used when displaying the map at higher zoom levels.

fields.name: attribution
fields.doc: Contains an attribution to be displayed when the map is shown to a user.

fields.name: promoteId
fields.doc: A property to use as a feature id (for feature state). Either a property name, or an object of the form `{<sourceLayer>: <propertyName>}`. If specified as a string for a vector tile source, the same property is used across all its source layers.

fields.name: volatile
fields.doc: A setting to determine whether a source's tiles are cached locally.

fields.name: type
fields.doc: The type of the source.

fields.name: url
fields.doc: A URL to a TileJSON resource. Supported protocols are `http:` and `https:`.

fields.name: tiles
fields.doc: An array of one or more tile source URLs, as in the TileJSON spec.

fields.name: bounds
fields.doc: An array containing the longitude and latitude of the southwest and northeast corners of the source's bounding box in the following order: `[sw.lng, sw.lat, ne.lng, ne.lat]`. When this property is included in a source, no tiles outside of the given bounds are requested by MapLibre.

fields.name: minzoom
fields.doc: Minimum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec.

fields.name: maxzoom
fields.doc: Maximum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec. Data from tiles at the maxzoom are used when displaying the map at higher zoom levels.

fields.name: tileSize
fields.doc: The minimum visual size to display tiles for this layer. Only configurable for raster layers.

fields.name: scheme
fields.doc: Influences the y direction of the tile coordinates. The global-mercator (aka Spherical Mercator) profile is assumed.

fields.name: attribution
fields.doc: Contains an attribution to be displayed when the map is shown to a user.

fields.name: volatile
fields.doc: A setting to determine whether a source's tiles are cached locally.

fields.name: type
fields.doc: The type of the source.

fields.name: url
fields.doc: A URL to a TileJSON resource. Supported protocols are `http:` and `https:`.

fields.name: tiles
fields.doc: An array of one or more tile source URLs, as in the TileJSON spec.

fields.name: bounds
fields.doc: An array containing the longitude and latitude of the southwest and northeast corners of the source's bounding box in the following order: `[sw.lng, sw.lat, ne.lng, ne.lat]`. When this property is included in a source, no tiles outside of the given bounds are requested by MapLibre.

fields.name: minzoom
fields.doc: Minimum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec.

fields.name: maxzoom
fields.doc: Maximum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec. Data from tiles at the maxzoom are used when displaying the map at higher zoom levels.

fields.name: tileSize
fields.doc: The minimum visual size to display tiles for this layer. Only configurable for raster layers.

fields.name: attribution
fields.doc: Contains an attribution to be displayed when the map is shown to a user.

fields.name: encoding
fields.doc: The encoding used by this source. Mapbox Terrain RGB is used by default.

fields.name: redFactor
fields.doc: Value that will be multiplied by the red channel value when decoding. Only used on custom encodings.

fields.name: blueFactor
fields.doc: Value that will be multiplied by the blue channel value when decoding. Only used on custom encodings.

fields.name: greenFactor
fields.doc: Value that will be multiplied by the green channel value when decoding. Only used on custom encodings.

fields.name: baseShift
fields.doc: Value that will be added to the encoding mix when decoding. Only used on custom encodings.

fields.name: volatile
fields.doc: A setting to determine whether a source's tiles are cached locally.

fields.name: type
fields.doc: The data type of the GeoJSON source.

fields.name: data
fields.doc: A URL to a GeoJSON file, or inline GeoJSON.

fields.name: maxzoom
fields.doc: Maximum zoom level at which to create vector tiles (higher means greater detail at high zoom levels).

fields.name: attribution
fields.doc: Contains an attribution to be displayed when the map is shown to a user.

fields.name: buffer
fields.doc: Size of the tile buffer on each side. A value of 0 produces no buffer. A value of 512 produces a buffer as wide as the tile itself. Larger values produce fewer rendering artifacts near tile edges and slower performance.

fields.name: filter
fields.doc: An expression for filtering features prior to processing them for rendering.

fields.name: tolerance
fields.doc: Douglas-Peucker simplification tolerance (higher means simpler geometries and faster performance).

fields.name: cluster
fields.doc:
If the data is a collection of point features, setting this to true clusters the points by radius into groups. Cluster groups become new `Point` features in the source with additional properties:

 * `cluster` Is `true` if the point is a cluster 

 * `cluster_id` A unique id for the cluster to be used in conjunction with the [cluster inspection methods](https://maplibre.org/maplibre-gl-js/docs/API/classes/GeoJSONSource/#getclusterexpansionzoom)

 * `point_count` Number of original points grouped into this cluster

 * `point_count_abbreviated` An abbreviated point count

fields.name: clusterRadius
fields.doc: Radius of each cluster if clustering is enabled. A value of 512 indicates a radius equal to the width of a tile.

fields.name: clusterMaxZoom
fields.doc: Max zoom on which to cluster points if clustering is enabled. Defaults to one zoom less than maxzoom (so that last zoom features are not clustered). Clusters are re-evaluated at integer zoom levels so setting clusterMaxZoom to 14 means the clusters will be displayed until z15.

fields.name: clusterMinPoints
fields.doc: Minimum number of points necessary to form a cluster if clustering is enabled. Defaults to `2`.

fields.name: clusterProperties
fields.doc:
An object defining custom properties on the generated clusters if clustering is enabled, aggregating values from clustered points. Has the form `{"property_name": [operator, map_expression]}`. `operator` is any expression function that accepts at least 2 operands (e.g. `"+"` or `"max"`) — it accumulates the property value from clusters/points the cluster contains; `map_expression` produces the value of a single point.

Example: `{"sum": ["+", ["get", "scalerank"]]}`.

For more advanced use cases, in place of `operator`, you can use a custom reduce expression that references a special `["accumulated"]` value, e.g.:

`{"sum": [["+", ["accumulated"], ["get", "sum"]], ["get", "scalerank"]]}`

fields.name: lineMetrics
fields.doc: Whether to calculate line distance metrics. This is required for line layers that specify `line-gradient` values.

fields.name: generateId
fields.doc: Whether to generate ids for the geojson features. When enabled, the `feature.id` property will be auto assigned based on its index in the `features` array, over-writing any previous values.

fields.name: promoteId
fields.doc: A property to use as a feature id (for feature state). Either a property name, or an object of the form `{<sourceLayer>: <propertyName>}`.

fields.name: type
fields.doc: The data type of the video source.

fields.name: urls
fields.doc: URLs to video content in order of preferred format.

fields.name: coordinates
fields.doc: Corners of video specified in longitude, latitude pairs.

fields.name: type
fields.doc: The data type of the image source.

fields.name: url
fields.doc: URL that points to an image.

fields.name: coordinates
fields.doc: Corners of image specified in longitude, latitude pairs.

fields.name: id
fields.doc: Unique layer name.

fields.name: type
fields.doc: Rendering type of this layer.

fields.name: metadata
fields.doc: Arbitrary properties useful to track with the layer, but do not influence rendering. Properties should be prefixed to avoid collisions, like 'maplibre:'.

fields.name: source
fields.doc: Name of a source description to be used for this layer. Required for all layer types except `background`.

fields.name: sourceLayer
fields.doc: Layer to use from a vector tile source. Required for vector tile sources; prohibited for all other source types, including GeoJSON sources.

fields.name: minzoom
fields.doc: The minimum zoom level for the layer. At zoom levels less than the minzoom, the layer will be hidden.

fields.name: maxzoom
fields.doc: The maximum zoom level for the layer. At zoom levels equal to or greater than the maxzoom, the layer will be hidden.

fields.name: filter
fields.doc: A expression specifying conditions on source features. Only features that match the filter are displayed. Zoom expressions in filters are only evaluated at integer zoom levels. The `feature-state` expression is not supported in filter expressions.

fields.name: layout
fields.doc: Layout properties for the layer.

fields.name: paint
fields.doc: Default paint properties for this layer.

fields.name: visibility
fields.doc: Whether this layer is displayed.

fields.name: fillSortKey
fields.doc: Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with a higher sort key will appear above features with a lower sort key.

fields.name: visibility
fields.doc: Whether this layer is displayed.

fields.name: circleSortKey
fields.doc: Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with a higher sort key will appear above features with a lower sort key.

fields.name: visibility
fields.doc: Whether this layer is displayed.

fields.name: visibility
fields.doc: Whether this layer is displayed.

fields.name: visibility
fields.doc: Whether this layer is displayed.

fields.name: lineCap
fields.doc: The display of line endings.

fields.name: lineJoin
fields.doc: The display of lines when joining.

fields.name: lineMiterLimit
fields.doc: Used to automatically convert miter joins to bevel joins for sharp angles.

fields.name: lineRoundLimit
fields.doc: Used to automatically convert round joins to miter joins for shallow angles.

fields.name: lineSortKey
fields.doc: Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with a higher sort key will appear above features with a lower sort key.

fields.name: visibility
fields.doc: Whether this layer is displayed.

fields.name: symbolPlacement
fields.doc: Label placement relative to its geometry.

fields.name: symbolSpacing
fields.doc: Distance between two symbol anchors.

fields.name: symbolAvoidEdges
fields.doc: If true, the symbols will not cross tile edges to avoid mutual collisions. Recommended in layers that don't have enough padding in the vector tile to prevent collisions, or if it is a point symbol layer placed after a line symbol layer. When using a client that supports global collision detection, like MapLibre GL JS version 0.42.0 or greater, enabling this property is not needed to prevent clipped labels at tile boundaries.

fields.name: symbolSortKey
fields.doc: Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with lower sort keys are drawn and placed first.  When `icon-allow-overlap` or `text-allow-overlap` is `false`, features with a lower sort key will have priority during placement. When `icon-allow-overlap` or `text-allow-overlap` is set to `true`, features with a higher sort key will overlap over features with a lower sort key.

fields.name: symbolZOrder
fields.doc: Determines whether overlapping symbols in the same layer are rendered in the order that they appear in the data source or by their y-position relative to the viewport. To control the order and prioritization of symbols otherwise, use `symbol-sort-key`.

fields.name: iconAllowOverlap
fields.doc: If true, the icon will be visible even if it collides with other previously drawn symbols.

fields.name: iconOverlap
fields.doc: Allows for control over whether to show an icon when it overlaps other symbols on the map. If `icon-overlap` is not set, `icon-allow-overlap` is used instead.

fields.name: iconIgnorePlacement
fields.doc: If true, other symbols can be visible even if they collide with the icon.

fields.name: iconOptional
fields.doc: If true, text will display without their corresponding icons when the icon collides with other symbols and the text does not.

fields.name: iconRotationAlignment
fields.doc: In combination with `symbol-placement`, determines the rotation behavior of icons.

fields.name: iconSize
fields.doc: Scales the original size of the icon by the provided factor. The new pixel size of the image will be the original pixel size multiplied by `icon-size`. 1 is the original size; 3 triples the size of the image.

fields.name: iconTextFit
fields.doc: Scales the icon to fit around the associated text.

fields.name: iconTextFitPadding
fields.doc: Size of the additional area added to dimensions determined by `icon-text-fit`, in clockwise order: top, right, bottom, left.

fields.name: iconImage
fields.doc: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing an image background.

fields.name: iconRotate
fields.doc: Rotates the icon clockwise.

fields.name: iconPadding
fields.doc: Size of additional area round the icon bounding box used for detecting symbol collisions.

fields.name: iconKeepUpright
fields.doc: If true, the icon may be flipped to prevent it from being rendered upside-down.

fields.name: iconOffset
fields.doc: Offset distance of icon from its anchor. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up. Each component is multiplied by the value of `icon-size` to obtain the final offset in pixels. When combined with `icon-rotate` the offset will be as if the rotated direction was up.

fields.name: iconAnchor
fields.doc: Part of the icon placed closest to the anchor.

fields.name: iconPitchAlignment
fields.doc: Orientation of icon when map is pitched.

fields.name: textPitchAlignment
fields.doc: Orientation of text when map is pitched.

fields.name: textRotationAlignment
fields.doc: In combination with `symbol-placement`, determines the rotation behavior of the individual glyphs forming the text.

fields.name: textField
fields.doc: Value to use for a text label. If a plain `string` is provided, it will be treated as a `formatted` with default/inherited formatting options.

fields.name: textFont
fields.doc: Font stack to use for displaying text.

fields.name: textSize
fields.doc: Font size.

fields.name: textMaxWidth
fields.doc: The maximum line width for text wrapping.

fields.name: textLineHeight
fields.doc: Text leading value for multi-line text.

fields.name: textLetterSpacing
fields.doc: Text tracking amount.

fields.name: textJustify
fields.doc: Text justification options.

fields.name: textRadialOffset
fields.doc: Radial offset of text, in the direction of the symbol's anchor. Useful in combination with `text-variable-anchor`, which defaults to using the two-dimensional `text-offset` if present.

fields.name: textVariableAnchor
fields.doc: To increase the chance of placing high-priority labels on the map, you can provide an array of `text-anchor` locations: the renderer will attempt to place the label at each location, in order, before moving onto the next label. Use `text-justify: auto` to choose justification based on anchor position. To apply an offset, use the `text-radial-offset` or the two-dimensional `text-offset`.

fields.name: textVariableAnchorOffset
fields.doc:
To increase the chance of placing high-priority labels on the map, you can provide an array of `text-anchor` locations, each paired with an offset value. The renderer will attempt to place the label at each location, in order, before moving on to the next location+offset. Use `text-justify: auto` to choose justification based on anchor position. 

 The length of the array must be even, and must alternate between enum and point entries. i.e., each anchor location must be accompanied by a point, and that point defines the offset when the corresponding anchor location is used. Positive offset values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up. Anchor locations may repeat, allowing the renderer to try multiple offsets to try and place a label using the same anchor. 

 When present, this property takes precedence over `text-anchor`, `text-variable-anchor`, `text-offset`, and `text-radial-offset`. 

 ```json 

 { "text-variable-anchor-offset": ["top", [0, 4], "left", [3,0], "bottom", [1, 1]] } 

 ``` 

 When the renderer chooses the `top` anchor, `[0, 4]` will be used for `text-offset`; the text will be shifted down by 4 ems. 

 When the renderer chooses the `left` anchor, `[3, 0]` will be used for `text-offset`; the text will be shifted right by 3 ems.

fields.name: textAnchor
fields.doc: Part of the text placed closest to the anchor.

fields.name: textMaxAngle
fields.doc: Maximum angle change between adjacent characters.

fields.name: textWritingMode
fields.doc: The property allows control over a symbol's orientation. Note that the property values act as a hint, so that a symbol whose language doesn’t support the provided orientation will be laid out in its natural orientation. Example: English point symbol will be rendered horizontally even if array value contains single 'vertical' enum value. The order of elements in an array define priority order for the placement of an orientation variant.

fields.name: textRotate
fields.doc: Rotates the text clockwise.

fields.name: textPadding
fields.doc: Size of the additional area around the text bounding box used for detecting symbol collisions.

fields.name: textKeepUpright
fields.doc: If true, the text may be flipped vertically to prevent it from being rendered upside-down.

fields.name: textTransform
fields.doc: Specifies how to capitalize text, similar to the CSS `text-transform` property.

fields.name: textOffset
fields.doc: Offset distance of text from its anchor. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up. If used with text-variable-anchor, input values will be taken as absolute values. Offsets along the x- and y-axis will be applied automatically based on the anchor position.

fields.name: textAllowOverlap
fields.doc: If true, the text will be visible even if it collides with other previously drawn symbols.

fields.name: textOverlap
fields.doc: Allows for control over whether to show symbol text when it overlaps other symbols on the map. If `text-overlap` is not set, `text-allow-overlap` is used instead

fields.name: textIgnorePlacement
fields.doc: If true, other symbols can be visible even if they collide with the text.

fields.name: textOptional
fields.doc: If true, icons will display without their corresponding text when the text collides with other symbols and the icon does not.

fields.name: visibility
fields.doc: Whether this layer is displayed.

fields.name: visibility
fields.doc: Whether this layer is displayed.

fields.name: visibility
fields.doc: Whether this layer is displayed.

fields.name: anchor
fields.doc: Whether extruded geometries are lit relative to the map or viewport.

fields.name: position
fields.doc: Position of the light source relative to lit (extruded) geometries, in [r radial coordinate, a azimuthal angle, p polar angle] where r indicates the distance from the center of the base of an object to its light, a indicates the position of the light relative to 0° (0° when `light.anchor` is set to `viewport` corresponds to the top of the viewport, or 0° when `light.anchor` is set to `map` corresponds to due north, and degrees proceed clockwise), and p indicates the height of the light (from 0°, directly above, to 180°, directly below).

fields.name: color
fields.doc: Color tint for lighting extruded geometries.

fields.name: intensity
fields.doc: Intensity of lighting (on a scale from 0 to 1). Higher numbers will present as more extreme contrast.

fields.name: skyColor
fields.doc: The base color for the sky.

fields.name: horizonColor
fields.doc: The base color at the horizon.

fields.name: fogColor
fields.doc: The base color for the fog. Requires 3D terrain.

fields.name: fogGroundBlend
fields.doc: How to blend the fog over the 3D terrain. Where 0 is the map center and 1 is the horizon.

fields.name: horizonFogBlend
fields.doc: How to blend the fog color and the horizon color. Where 0 is using the horizon color only and 1 is using the fog color only.

fields.name: skyHorizonBlend
fields.doc: How to blend the the sky color and the horizon color. Where 1 is blending the color at the middle of the sky and 0 is not blending at all and using the sky color only.

fields.name: atmosphereBlend
fields.doc: How to blend the atmosphere. Where 1 is visible atmosphere and 0 is hidden. It is best to interpolate this expression when using globe projection.

fields.name: source
fields.doc: The source for the terrain data.

fields.name: exaggeration
fields.doc: The exaggeration of the terrain - how high it will look.

fields.name: type
fields.doc: The projection type.

fields.name: fillAntialias
fields.doc: Whether or not the fill should be antialiased.

fields.name: fillOpacity
fields.doc: The opacity of the entire fill layer. In contrast to the `fill-color`, this value will also affect the 1px stroke around the fill, if the stroke is used.

fields.name: fillColor
fields.doc: The color of the filled part of this layer. This color can be specified as `rgba` with an alpha component and the color's opacity will not affect the opacity of the 1px stroke, if it is used.

fields.name: fillOutlineColor
fields.doc: The outline color of the fill. Matches the value of `fill-color` if unspecified.

fields.name: fillTranslate
fields.doc: The geometry's offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.

fields.name: fillTranslateAnchor
fields.doc: Controls the frame of reference for `fill-translate`.

fields.name: fillPattern
fields.doc: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing image fills. For seamless patterns, image width and height must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, ..., 512). Note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

fields.name: fillExtrusionOpacity
fields.doc: The opacity of the entire fill extrusion layer. This is rendered on a per-layer, not per-feature, basis, and data-driven styling is not available.

fields.name: fillExtrusionColor
fields.doc: The base color of the extruded fill. The extrusion's surfaces will be shaded differently based on this color in combination with the root `light` settings. If this color is specified as `rgba` with an alpha component, the alpha component will be ignored; use `fill-extrusion-opacity` to set layer opacity.

fields.name: fillExtrusionTranslate
fields.doc: The geometry's offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up (on the flat plane), respectively.

fields.name: fillExtrusionTranslateAnchor
fields.doc: Controls the frame of reference for `fill-extrusion-translate`.

fields.name: fillExtrusionPattern
fields.doc: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing images on extruded fills. For seamless patterns, image width and height must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, ..., 512). Note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

fields.name: fillExtrusionHeight
fields.doc: The height with which to extrude this layer.

fields.name: fillExtrusionBase
fields.doc: The height with which to extrude the base of this layer. Must be less than or equal to `fill-extrusion-height`.

fields.name: fillExtrusionVerticalGradient
fields.doc: Whether to apply a vertical gradient to the sides of a fill-extrusion layer. If true, sides will be shaded slightly darker farther down.

fields.name: lineOpacity
fields.doc: The opacity at which the line will be drawn.

fields.name: lineColor
fields.doc: The color with which the line will be drawn.

fields.name: lineTranslate
fields.doc: The geometry's offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.

fields.name: lineTranslateAnchor
fields.doc: Controls the frame of reference for `line-translate`.

fields.name: lineWidth
fields.doc: Stroke thickness.

fields.name: lineGapWidth
fields.doc: Draws a line casing outside of a line's actual path. Value indicates the width of the inner gap.

fields.name: lineOffset
fields.doc: The line's offset. For linear features, a positive value offsets the line to the right, relative to the direction of the line, and a negative value to the left. For polygon features, a positive value results in an inset, and a negative value results in an outset.

fields.name: lineBlur
fields.doc: Blur applied to the line, in pixels.

fields.name: lineDasharray
fields.doc: Specifies the lengths of the alternating dashes and gaps that form the dash pattern. The lengths are later scaled by the line width. To convert a dash length to pixels, multiply the length by the current line width. Note that GeoJSON sources with `lineMetrics: true` specified won't render dashed lines to the expected scale. Also note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

fields.name: linePattern
fields.doc: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing image lines. For seamless patterns, image width must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, ..., 512). Note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

fields.name: lineGradient
fields.doc: Defines a gradient with which to color a line feature. Can only be used with GeoJSON sources that specify `"lineMetrics": true`.

fields.name: circleRadius
fields.doc: Circle radius.

fields.name: circleColor
fields.doc: The fill color of the circle.

fields.name: circleBlur
fields.doc: Amount to blur the circle. 1 blurs the circle such that only the centerpoint is full opacity.

fields.name: circleOpacity
fields.doc: The opacity at which the circle will be drawn.

fields.name: circleTranslate
fields.doc: The geometry's offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.

fields.name: circleTranslateAnchor
fields.doc: Controls the frame of reference for `circle-translate`.

fields.name: circlePitchScale
fields.doc: Controls the scaling behavior of the circle when the map is pitched.

fields.name: circlePitchAlignment
fields.doc: Orientation of circle when map is pitched.

fields.name: circleStrokeWidth
fields.doc: The width of the circle's stroke. Strokes are placed outside of the `circle-radius`.

fields.name: circleStrokeColor
fields.doc: The stroke color of the circle.

fields.name: circleStrokeOpacity
fields.doc: The opacity of the circle's stroke.

fields.name: heatmapRadius
fields.doc: Radius of influence of one heatmap point in pixels. Increasing the value makes the heatmap smoother, but less detailed.

fields.name: heatmapWeight
fields.doc: A measure of how much an individual point contributes to the heatmap. A value of 10 would be equivalent to having 10 points of weight 1 in the same spot. Especially useful when combined with clustering.

fields.name: heatmapIntensity
fields.doc: Similar to `heatmap-weight` but controls the intensity of the heatmap globally. Primarily used for adjusting the heatmap based on zoom level.

fields.name: heatmapColor
fields.doc: Defines the color of each pixel based on its density value in a heatmap.  Should be an expression that uses `["heatmap-density"]` as input.

fields.name: heatmapOpacity
fields.doc: The global opacity at which the heatmap layer will be drawn.

fields.name: iconOpacity
fields.doc: The opacity at which the icon will be drawn.

fields.name: iconColor
fields.doc: The color of the icon. This can only be used with SDF icons.

fields.name: iconHaloColor
fields.doc: The color of the icon's halo. Icon halos can only be used with SDF icons.

fields.name: iconHaloWidth
fields.doc:
Distance of halo to the icon outline. 

The unit is in pixels only for SDF sprites that were created with a blur radius of 8, multiplied by the display density. I.e., the radius needs to be 16 for `@2x` sprites, etc.

fields.name: iconHaloBlur
fields.doc: Fade out the halo towards the outside.

fields.name: iconTranslate
fields.doc: Distance that the icon's anchor is moved from its original placement. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up.

fields.name: iconTranslateAnchor
fields.doc: Controls the frame of reference for `icon-translate`.

fields.name: textOpacity
fields.doc: The opacity at which the text will be drawn.

fields.name: textColor
fields.doc: The color with which the text will be drawn.

fields.name: textHaloColor
fields.doc: The color of the text's halo, which helps it stand out from backgrounds.

fields.name: textHaloWidth
fields.doc: Distance of halo to the font outline. Max text halo width is 1/4 of the font-size.

fields.name: textHaloBlur
fields.doc: The halo's fadeout distance towards the outside.

fields.name: textTranslate
fields.doc: Distance that the text's anchor is moved from its original placement. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up.

fields.name: textTranslateAnchor
fields.doc: Controls the frame of reference for `text-translate`.

fields.name: rasterOpacity
fields.doc: The opacity at which the image will be drawn.

fields.name: rasterHueRotate
fields.doc: Rotates hues around the color wheel.

fields.name: rasterBrightnessMin
fields.doc: Increase or reduce the brightness of the image. The value is the minimum brightness.

fields.name: rasterBrightnessMax
fields.doc: Increase or reduce the brightness of the image. The value is the maximum brightness.

fields.name: rasterSaturation
fields.doc: Increase or reduce the saturation of the image.

fields.name: rasterContrast
fields.doc: Increase or reduce the contrast of the image.

fields.name: rasterResampling
fields.doc: The resampling/interpolation method to use for overscaling, also known as texture magnification filter

fields.name: rasterFadeDuration
fields.doc: Fade duration when a new tile is added, or when a video is started or its coordinates are updated.

fields.name: hillshadeIlluminationDirection
fields.doc: The direction of the light source used to generate the hillshading with 0 as the top of the viewport if `hillshade-illumination-anchor` is set to `viewport` and due north if `hillshade-illumination-anchor` is set to `map`.

fields.name: hillshadeIlluminationAnchor
fields.doc: Direction of light source when map is rotated.

fields.name: hillshadeExaggeration
fields.doc: Intensity of the hillshade

fields.name: hillshadeShadowColor
fields.doc: The shading color of areas that face away from the light source.

fields.name: hillshadeHighlightColor
fields.doc: The shading color of areas that faces towards the light source.

fields.name: hillshadeAccentColor
fields.doc: The shading color used to accentuate rugged terrain like sharp cliffs and gorges.

fields.name: backgroundColor
fields.doc: The color with which the background will be drawn.

fields.name: backgroundPattern
fields.doc: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing an image background. For seamless patterns, image width and height must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, ..., 512). Note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

fields.name: backgroundOpacity
fields.doc: The opacity at which the background will be drawn.

fields.name: duration
fields.doc: Time allotted for transitions to complete.

fields.name: delay
fields.doc: Length of time before a transition begins.

values.name: vector
values.doc: A vector tile source.

values.name: xyz
values.doc: Slippy map tilenames scheme.

values.name: tms
values.doc: OSGeo spec scheme.

values.name: raster
values.doc: A raster tile source.

values.name: xyz
values.doc: Slippy map tilenames scheme.

values.name: tms
values.doc: OSGeo spec scheme.

values.name: rasterDem
values.doc: A RGB-encoded raster DEM source

values.name: terrarium
values.doc: Terrarium format PNG tiles. See https://aws.amazon.com/es/public-datasets/terrain/ for more info.

values.name: mapbox
values.doc: Mapbox Terrain RGB tiles. See https://www.mapbox.com/help/access-elevation-data/#mapbox-terrain-rgb for more info.

values.name: custom
values.doc: Decodes tiles using the redFactor, blueFactor, greenFactor, baseShift parameters.

values.name: geojson
values.doc: A GeoJSON data source.

values.name: video
values.doc: A video data source.

values.name: image
values.doc: An image data source.

values.name: fill
values.doc: A filled polygon with an optional stroked border.

values.name: line
values.doc: A stroked line.

values.name: symbol
values.doc: An icon or a text label.

values.name: circle
values.doc: A filled circle.

values.name: heatmap
values.doc: A heatmap.

values.name: fillExtrusion
values.doc: An extruded (3D) polygon.

values.name: raster
values.doc: Raster map textures such as satellite imagery.

values.name: hillshade
values.doc: Client-side hillshading visualization based on DEM data. The implementation supports Mapbox Terrain RGB, Mapzen Terrarium tiles and custom encodings.

values.name: background
values.doc: The background color or pattern of the map.

values.name: visible
values.doc: The layer is shown.

values.name: none
values.doc: The layer is not shown.

values.name: butt
values.doc: A cap with a squared-off end which is drawn to the exact endpoint of the line.

values.name: round
values.doc: A cap with a rounded end which is drawn beyond the endpoint of the line at a radius of one-half of the line's width and centered on the endpoint of the line.

values.name: square
values.doc: A cap with a squared-off end which is drawn beyond the endpoint of the line at a distance of one-half of the line's width.

values.name: bevel
values.doc: A join with a squared-off end which is drawn beyond the endpoint of the line at a distance of one-half of the line's width.

values.name: round
values.doc: A join with a rounded end which is drawn beyond the endpoint of the line at a radius of one-half of the line's width and centered on the endpoint of the line.

values.name: miter
values.doc: A join with a sharp, angled corner which is drawn with the outer sides beyond the endpoint of the path until they meet.

values.name: point
values.doc: The label is placed at the point where the geometry is located.

values.name: line
values.doc: The label is placed along the line of the geometry. Can only be used on `LineString` and `Polygon` geometries.

values.name: lineCenter
values.doc: The label is placed at the center of the line of the geometry. Can only be used on `LineString` and `Polygon` geometries. Note that a single feature in a vector tile may contain multiple line geometries.

values.name: auto
values.doc: Sorts symbols by `symbol-sort-key` if set. Otherwise, sorts symbols by their y-position relative to the viewport if `icon-allow-overlap` or `text-allow-overlap` is set to `true` or `icon-ignore-placement` or `text-ignore-placement` is `false`.

values.name: viewportY
values.doc: Sorts symbols by their y-position relative to the viewport if `icon-allow-overlap` or `text-allow-overlap` is set to `true` or `icon-ignore-placement` or `text-ignore-placement` is `false`.

values.name: source
values.doc: Sorts symbols by `symbol-sort-key` if set. Otherwise, no sorting is applied; symbols are rendered in the same order as the source data.

values.name: never
values.doc: The icon will be hidden if it collides with any other previously drawn symbol.

values.name: always
values.doc: The icon will be visible even if it collides with any other previously drawn symbol.

values.name: cooperative
values.doc: If the icon collides with another previously drawn symbol, the overlap mode for that symbol is checked. If the previous symbol was placed using `never` overlap mode, the new icon is hidden. If the previous symbol was placed using `always` or `cooperative` overlap mode, the new icon is visible.

values.name: map
values.doc: When `symbol-placement` is set to `point`, aligns icons east-west. When `symbol-placement` is set to `line` or `line-center`, aligns icon x-axes with the line.

values.name: viewport
values.doc: Produces icons whose x-axes are aligned with the x-axis of the viewport, regardless of the value of `symbol-placement`.

values.name: auto
values.doc: When `symbol-placement` is set to `point`, this is equivalent to `viewport`. When `symbol-placement` is set to `line` or `line-center`, this is equivalent to `map`.

values.name: none
values.doc: The icon is displayed at its intrinsic aspect ratio.

values.name: width
values.doc: The icon is scaled in the x-dimension to fit the width of the text.

values.name: height
values.doc: The icon is scaled in the y-dimension to fit the height of the text.

values.name: both
values.doc: The icon is scaled in both x- and y-dimensions.

values.name: center
values.doc: The center of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: left
values.doc: The left side of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: right
values.doc: The right side of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: top
values.doc: The top of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: bottom
values.doc: The bottom of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: topLeft
values.doc: The top left corner of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: topRight
values.doc: The top right corner of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: bottomLeft
values.doc: The bottom left corner of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: bottomRight
values.doc: The bottom right corner of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: map
values.doc: The icon is aligned to the plane of the map.

values.name: viewport
values.doc: The icon is aligned to the plane of the viewport.

values.name: auto
values.doc: Automatically matches the value of `icon-rotation-alignment`.

values.name: map
values.doc: The text is aligned to the plane of the map.

values.name: viewport
values.doc: The text is aligned to the plane of the viewport.

values.name: auto
values.doc: Automatically matches the value of `text-rotation-alignment`.

values.name: map
values.doc: When `symbol-placement` is set to `point`, aligns text east-west. When `symbol-placement` is set to `line` or `line-center`, aligns text x-axes with the line.

values.name: viewport
values.doc: Produces glyphs whose x-axes are aligned with the x-axis of the viewport, regardless of the value of `symbol-placement`.

values.name: viewportGlyph
values.doc: When `symbol-placement` is set to `point`, aligns text to the x-axis of the viewport. When `symbol-placement` is set to `line` or `line-center`, aligns glyphs to the x-axis of the viewport and places them along the line.

values.name: auto
values.doc: When `symbol-placement` is set to `point`, this is equivalent to `viewport`. When `symbol-placement` is set to `line` or `line-center`, this is equivalent to `map`.

values.name: auto
values.doc: The text is aligned towards the anchor position.

values.name: left
values.doc: The text is aligned to the left.

values.name: center
values.doc: The text is centered.

values.name: right
values.doc: The text is aligned to the right.

values.name: center
values.doc: The center of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: left
values.doc: The left side of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: right
values.doc: The right side of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: top
values.doc: The top of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: bottom
values.doc: The bottom of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: topLeft
values.doc: The top left corner of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: topRight
values.doc: The top right corner of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: bottomLeft
values.doc: The bottom left corner of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: bottomRight
values.doc: The bottom right corner of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: center
values.doc: The center of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: left
values.doc: The left side of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: right
values.doc: The right side of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: top
values.doc: The top of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: bottom
values.doc: The bottom of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: topLeft
values.doc: The top left corner of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: topRight
values.doc: The top right corner of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: bottomLeft
values.doc: The bottom left corner of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: bottomRight
values.doc: The bottom right corner of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

values.name: horizontal
values.doc: If a text's language supports horizontal writing mode, symbols with point placement would be laid out horizontally.

values.name: vertical
values.doc: If a text's language supports vertical writing mode, symbols with point placement would be laid out vertically.

values.name: none
values.doc: The text is not altered.

values.name: uppercase
values.doc: Forces all letters to be displayed in uppercase.

values.name: lowercase
values.doc: Forces all letters to be displayed in lowercase.

values.name: never
values.doc: The text will be hidden if it collides with any other previously drawn symbol.

values.name: always
values.doc: The text will be visible even if it collides with any other previously drawn symbol.

values.name: cooperative
values.doc: If the text collides with another previously drawn symbol, the overlap mode for that symbol is checked. If the previous symbol was placed using `never` overlap mode, the new text is hidden. If the previous symbol was placed using `always` or `cooperative` overlap mode, the new text is visible.

values.name: map
values.doc: The position of the light source is aligned to the rotation of the map.

values.name: viewport
values.doc: The position of the light source is aligned to the rotation of the viewport.

values.name: mercator
values.doc: The Mercator projection.

values.name: globe
values.doc: The globe projection.

values.name: map
values.doc: The fill is translated relative to the map.

values.name: viewport
values.doc: The fill is translated relative to the viewport.

values.name: map
values.doc: The fill extrusion is translated relative to the map.

values.name: viewport
values.doc: The fill extrusion is translated relative to the viewport.

values.name: map
values.doc: The line is translated relative to the map.

values.name: viewport
values.doc: The line is translated relative to the viewport.

values.name: map
values.doc: The circle is translated relative to the map.

values.name: viewport
values.doc: The circle is translated relative to the viewport.

values.name: map
values.doc: Circles are scaled according to their apparent distance to the camera.

values.name: viewport
values.doc: Circles are not scaled.

values.name: map
values.doc: The circle is aligned to the plane of the map.

values.name: viewport
values.doc: The circle is aligned to the plane of the viewport.

values.name: map
values.doc: Icons are translated relative to the map.

values.name: viewport
values.doc: Icons are translated relative to the viewport.

values.name: map
values.doc: The text is translated relative to the map.

values.name: viewport
values.doc: The text is translated relative to the viewport.

values.name: linear
values.doc: (Bi)linear filtering interpolates pixel values using the weighted average of the four closest original source pixels creating a smooth but blurry look when overscaled

values.name: nearest
values.doc: Nearest neighbor filtering interpolates pixel values using the nearest original source pixel creating a sharp but pixelated look when overscaled

values.name: map
values.doc: The hillshade illumination is relative to the north direction.

values.name: viewport
values.doc: The hillshade illumination is relative to the top of the viewport.
